name: Cox's Bazar Sea Beach
description: The longest sea beach in the world, stretching over 120 km, known for its natural beauty and serene environment.

name: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to the Royal Bengal Tiger and one of the largest mangrove forests in the world.

name: Bandarban Hill Tracts
description: A picturesque area with rolling hills, waterfalls, and tribal villages offering a serene getaway.

name: Saint Martin's Island
description: A tropical coral island with clear blue waters, palm-fringed beaches, and vibrant marine life.

name: Srimangal Tea Garden
description: Known as the 'Tea Capital of Bangladesh,' offering lush green tea estates and tranquil surroundings.

name: Ahsan Manzil
description: An iconic pink palace that was once the residence of the Nawabs of Dhaka, now a museum.

name: Lalbagh Fort
description: An incomplete 17th-century Mughal fort known for its historic significance and architecture.

name: Kuakata Sea Beach
description: Known as the 'Daughter of the Sea,' offering both sunrise and sunset views over the Bay of Bengal.

name: Rangamati Hanging Bridge
description: A popular tourist attraction over Kaptai Lake offering stunning views of the surrounding hills and water.

name: Paharpur Buddhist Monastery
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the largest Buddhist monasteries in South Asia.

name: Jaflong
description: Known for its scenic beauty, stone collection points, and the view of the Meghalaya hills across the border.

name: Ratargul Swamp Forest
description: A freshwater swamp forest and a unique natural ecosystem, offering boat rides through submerged trees.

name: Boga Lake
description: A pristine high-altitude lake surrounded by lush green hills, popular for trekking and camping.

name: Madhabkunda Waterfall
description: The largest waterfall in Bangladesh, nestled within lush greenery, attracting nature lovers and hikers.

name: Foy's Lake
description: A man-made lake offering recreational activities, including boat rides and an amusement park.

name: Sonargaon
description: The ancient capital of Bengal, rich in history, with attractions like Panam City and the Folk Art Museum.

name: Tanguar Haor
description: A large wetland known for its biodiversity, migratory birds, and mesmerizing beauty during the rainy season.

name: Nilgiri Hills
description: One of the highest peaks in Bangladesh, offering breathtaking views of clouds, hills, and sunrise.

name: Mahasthangarh
description: The oldest archaeological site in Bangladesh, dating back to 3rd century BC, rich in history and artifacts.

name: Shaat Gombuj Mosque
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, famous for its impressive 60-domed structure and historical significance.
